title: Calories in a Kalamata Olive
meta_description: Discover calories in a kalamata olive, including fat, sodium, and full nutrition breakdown per olive plus quick tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Average pitted Kalamata olive (~5 g), brined in salt and vinegar, no added oil.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, brand, curing method, and whether pitted; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A single Kalamata olive contains about 11 kcal, mostly from healthy fats.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a kalamata olive?
faqs.a: Approximately 11 kcal per average pitted olive.

faqs.q: Are kalamata olives high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, about 1 g fat per olive, mostly monounsaturated.

faqs.q: What's the sodium in one kalamata olive?
faqs.a: Around 247 mg, due to brining; rinse to reduce.

faqs.q: Do kalamata olives have carbs or fiber?
faqs.a: Low carbs (0.3 g) and some fiber (0.2 g) per olive.

faqs.q: How does olive size affect calories?
faqs.a: Larger olives (~7 g) may have 15-20 kcal; smaller ones less.
